ext_descriptions.ext_description: A predefined_3d_purpose lists the predefined types of the 3d purpose.
specifies the purpose to be an analysis input;
specifies the purpose to be an analysis output;
specifies the purpose to be a shock analysis input;
specifies the purpose to be a shock analysis output;
specifies the purpose to be a design;
specifies the purpose to be a vibration analysis input;
specifies the purpose to be a vibration analysis output;
specifies the purpose to be an electromagnetic compatibility analysis input;
specifies the purpose to be an electromagnetic compatibility analysis output;
specifies the purpose to be a thermal analysis input;
specifies the purpose to be a thermal analysis output;
A shape_class lists the classes of the shape.
specifies shape to be an extrusion;
specifies shape to be a manhattan block;
specifies some other class of a shape;

ext_description.p: A Physical_unit_3d_keepout_shape is a type of and a type of . A Physical_unit_3d_keepout_shape is the shape in three orthogonal dimensions of a keepout constraint for a .
ext_description.note: Keepout regions typically include some minimal spacing around the extreme shape.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the shape_classification specifies the for the Physical_unit_3d_keepout_shape as extrusion, manhattan_block, other, or is_unknown.

ext_description.p: A Physical_unit_3d_shape is a type of and a type of . A Physical_unit_3d_shape is the shape in three orthogonal dimensions of a . A Physical_unit_3d_shape may be included for purposes which include the actual shape or boundaries of the actual shape. A shall not be referenced by a Physical_unit_3d_shape.
ext_description.note: When a extreme boundary of the actual shape is provided, mass property calculations based on the extreme shape may be invalid, depending on the purpose. For example, the centroid location in particular may not be valid for an extreme shape representing the envelope of a mult-mode vibration since the centroid may also vary over a range.
The shape for a is provided by a , eliminating the requirement to support a shape for a separately.

ext_description.p: the shape_classification specifies a role of the for the Physical_unit_3d_shape.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the shape_purpose specifies the as a predefined_3d_purpose or an .
